RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Stable Isotope Geochemist.
Marine Geochemistry professor at the Institute of Oceanography - University of Sao Paulo (Brazil).

Scientific Interests: Marine Geochemistry, Paleoclimatology, Paleoceanography, Microbial isotope fractionation processes.

Curriculum:

2001: MSc in Stable Isotope Geochemistry - University of Trieste (Italy).

2005: PhD in Paleoceanography - Christian Albrechts Universitaet, Kiel (Germany).

2006 to 2011: Institute de Physique du Globe de Paris (France). Posdoc on carbon isotope fractionation during microbial degradation of urea.

2011 to 2014: Institute of Geosciences - University of Sao Paulo USP (Brazil). Posdoc on oxygen isotope composition of fluid inclusions in stalagmites.

2014 to present: Marine Geochemistry professor at the Institute of Oceanography - University of Sao Paulo (Brazil).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: doctorate at Paleoceanografia from Christian-Albrechts-Universitt zu Kiel (2005). Has experience in Geosciences

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Caraterizao isotpica de cidos hmicos e adsoro de metais pesados no sistema estuarino de Cananeia-Iguape (estado de So Paulo)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
cidos hmicos so definidos como uma mistura de compostos orgnicos formados pela
degradao de plantas e resduos microbianos. Esses compostos so de interesse ambiental
por causa do seu alto poder de adsoro de metais, o que pode influenciar a mobilidade de
metais pesados em ambientes estuarinos impactados pela minerao. O sistema estuarino de
Cananeia-Iguape (estado de So Paulo), atualmente rea de proteo ambiental, sofre
contaminao por metais pesados, principalmente Pb, devido ao aporte de resduos de
minerao oriundos da bacia do rio Ribeira de Iguape. Embora no haja mais uma intensa
atividade extrativa desde o sculo passado, recentes estudos demonstram que a quantidade de
Pb no sedimento ainda atinge nveis preocupantes. esperado que uma quantidade
significativa de Pb e outros metais pesados seja adsorvida sobre cidos hmicos e retida nos
sedimentos. O presente projeto visa (i) identificar a fonte principal (marinha ou continental)
de cidos hmicos no sistema estuarino de Cananeia-Iguape com base na composio
isotpica do carbono e nitrognio; (ii) mapear a abundancia e a distribuio de cidos
hmicos de origem marinha e continental; (iii) quantificar o Pb e outros metais pesados
adsorvidos sobre cidos hmicos de origem marinha e continental, de forma avaliar qual tipo
possui maior afinidade qumica com os metais. Os resultados esperados iro aprimorar nosso
entendimento sobre o papel dos cidos hmicos na disperso de metais pesados em ambiente
estuarino. O projeto tem relevncia social, considerado que o sistema estuarino de Cananeia-
Iguape Area de Proteo Ambiental reconhecida pela UNESCO com presena de numerosas
comunidades pesqueiras tradicionais.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Humic acids are mixtures of organic matter formed during the decay of plants and microbial
remains. Humic acids are capable of binding heavy metals through surface adsorption, which
makes these organic compounds extremely interesting in environmental studies of estuarine
systems impacted by mining activities. The Cananeia-Iguape estuarine system (So Paulo
state, Brazil), today under environmental protection, presents moderate contamination by Pb.
Recent studies pointed out that the relatively high concentration of Pb in the sediment, linked
to past mining activities in the Ribeira River Basin, still constitutes a potential concern for the
environment. It is likely that a significant amount of Pb and other heavy metals be bound to
humic acids within the sediments. This project aims at (i) identifying the dominant source
(marine or terrestrial) of humic acids in the Cananeia-Iguape estuarine system by carbon and
nitrogen isotopic analysis; (ii) mapping the spatial abundance of marine and terrestrial humic
acids; (iii) using elemental analysis to assess the retention capacity of marine and terrestrial
humic acids with respect to Pb and other heavy metals. The results of this project are expected
to give insights into the role of humic acids in controlling the dispersion of Pb in estuaries.
The project is of potentially high societal relevance, given that the study area is a Biosphere
Reserve recognized by UNESCO, hosting numerous traditional fishing communities.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Stable isotope characterization of humic acids and retention capacity for Pb and other heavy metals in the Cananeia-Iguape coastal system (So Paulo - Brazil)
